meanings.definition: To bring back into existence or use
meanings.sent1: I will reintroduce my favorite toy to play with.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to reintroduce a fun game to the classroom.
meanings.sent3: Let's reintroduce the idea of having a picnic for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The old tradition was reintroduced with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: She reintroduced the classic song to the audience with a new twist.

meanings.definition: To present or bring back into a group or place
meanings.sent1: The zoo will reintroduce the panda to its natural habitat.
meanings.sent2: The host will reintroduce the next speaker to the stage.
meanings.sent3: Let's reintroduce the missing puzzle piece to the jigsaw.
meanings.sent4: The museum will reintroduce the ancient artifact to the exhibit.
meanings.sent5: He will reintroduce the lost dog to its owner with joy.

meanings.sent1: The author will reintroduce the main character in the sequel.
meanings.sent2: The scientist will reintroduce the experiment with new variables.
meanings.sent3: Let's reintroduce the topic of recycling in our discussion.
meanings.sent4: The chef will reintroduce the popular dish on the menu.
meanings.sent5: She will reintroduce the forgotten rule during the game.
